video.title: Networks: Collision Detection and Avoidance
video.description:
We're busy people who learn to code, then practice by building projects for nonprofits. Learn Full-stack JavaScript, build a portfolio, and get great references with our open source community.

Join our community at https://freecodecamp.com
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/freecodecamp
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/freecodecamp
Follow Quincy on Quora: https://www.quora.com/Quincy-Larson

topLevelComment.author: Pierre McGrail
topLevelComment.text: Listening is carrier sensing. CD is the result which is not garanteed if multiple devices start talking at the same time. This is wrong.

topLevelComment.author: Kumauni Phantom
topLevelComment.text: Team please upload a 10 hours video of active directory 2016 /2019

topLevelComment.author: Thick Boy
topLevelComment.text: This is so wrong. CD also checks the status of the line before sending data. It's largely the RTS/CTS function of CA that differentiates between them, which you never mentioned. Also, you never mentioned CD's random countdown timer that initiates after collision is detected. Please either delete or fix this video as you're misleading people.

topLevelComment.author: Fredo Corleone
topLevelComment.text: Useless playlist, too short and trivial

replies.author: sam sam
replies.text: it is for a different target audience. i wouldn't say it's useless

replies.text: I was waiting for something i didn't already know and then it just ended :(
